name: Extra Strength Tylenol
whenToUse: Moderate relief from pain associated with back, headache, muscle, arthritis, menstration, dental and/or cold/flu.

name: Reactine
whenToUse: Fast 24 hour relief of sneezing, stuffiness, itchy eyes/nose/throat, nasal congestion/runs, allergic skin itch.
dosingInterval: >=12 years of age: 1 tablet every 24 hours

name: Advil
whenToUse: For minor aches and pains due to: headache, toothache, backache, menstrual cramps, cold, muscles, arthritis, fever

name: Immodium
dosingInterval: 2 tablets initially with 250 mL water on an empty stomach followed by 1 tablet after each loose bowel movement

name: Gaviscon
whenToUse: For heartburn, acid indigestion, sour stomach or upset stomach
activeIngredient: 160 mg aluminum hydroxide, 105 mg magnesium carbonate
dosingInterval: 1-4 tablets after meals, at bedtime or as needed

name: Tums
whenToUse: For heartburn, acid indigestion or upset stomach

name: Tylenol Nighttime Cold/Flu
whenToUse: For sleeping with nasal congestion, aches/pains/chills, fever, sore throat, dry cough, headache, runny nose

name: Tylenol Daytime Cold/Flu
whenToUse: Relief from nasal congestion, aches/pains/chills, fever, sore throat, dry cough, headache, runny nose
activeIngredient: cough supressant, decongestant, cough expectorant, acetaminophen

name: Gravol
whenToUse: For nausea, vomiting, dizziness and motion sickness
